page.title: 09TOURISM
page.content: Being relatively close to a coast renowned for its wildlife, sailing and attractive beaches, the area has recently seen the growth of tourist-based activities. The most obvious has been the opening of three privately owned sites for touring caravans. There are also about twelve holiday cottages, some used by their owners, some let to visitors. This is not a wholly good thing for it means empty houses in wintertime which can lead to depopulation. In the season pleasure is given to tourists by the tranquil scene around the pond and the feeding of the many ducks there. Visiting artists too make a pleasant summer sight. Prominent here is the Village Sign on its plinth of flintstones, depicting the shadowy founder of the village.
